walkthroughs.title: Get Started with Coreflux
walkthroughs.description: Learn how to build IoT solutions with Language of Things (LOT)

steps.title: Create your first LOT notebook file
steps.description:
**What is LOT?** LOT (Language of Things) is a simple programming language designed for IoT applications. It makes it easy to create automated behaviors for smart devices.

**Why notebooks?** LOT notebooks combine code, documentation, and visualizations in one place, making it perfect for learning and prototyping IoT solutions.

**What you'll create:** A new .lotnb file where you'll write your IoT automation code.

[Create LOT Notebook](command:lot-notebook.new)

steps.title: Add walkthrough explanation
steps.description:
**What is this step?** Adding documentation to explain what you're building and why.

**Why documentation matters:** Good documentation helps you understand the purpose of each part of your IoT solution and makes it easier to share with others.

**What you'll create:** A markdown cell with a complete guide explaining the smart office monitoring system you'll build.

[Add Walkthrough Guide](command:coreflux.createMarkdownFile)

steps.title: Connect to your broker
steps.description:
**What is an MQTT broker?** An MQTT broker is like a central post office for IoT devices. It receives messages from devices and delivers them to other devices that need that information.

**Why do we need it?** Your LOT actions need somewhere to send their data and receive commands. The broker makes this communication possible.

**What happens when connected:** Once connected, your actions can start sending data and your devices can communicate in real-time.

[Connect to Broker](command:coreflux.connectBroker)

steps.title: Create an Action that runs every 1 second
steps.description:
**What is an Action?** An Action is like a recipe that tells your IoT system what to do automatically. It can run on a schedule, respond to events, or react to sensor data.

**Why every 1 second?** This creates a "heartbeat" signal that shows your system is alive and working. It's like a pulse that confirms everything is running properly.

**What it does:** This action will publish a simple message every second to demonstrate continuous operation.

[Create Timer Action](command:coreflux.createTimerAction)

steps.title: Upload the Action to the broker
steps.description:
**What is uploading?** Uploading sends your Action code to the broker where it will actually run and execute your automation.

**Why upload to broker?** The broker is where your Actions live and work. Without uploading, your code is just sitting in the notebook - it won't actually do anything.

**What happens after upload:** Your Action starts running on the broker and will continue running until you stop it. You can see it working in real-time!

[Upload Action](command:coreflux.uploadAction)

steps.title: Create a MODEL
steps.description:
**What is a Model?** A Model is like a template that defines the structure of your data. It's like creating a form where you specify what information you want to collect.

**Why use Models?** Instead of sending random data, Models ensure your information is organized and consistent. It's like having a standard format for all your sensor readings.

**What you'll create:** A SensorReading model with fields for temperature, humidity, location, and timestamp.

[Create Model](command:coreflux.createModel)

steps.title: Create an Action that publishes the MODEL
steps.description:
**What is a Model Action?** This is an Action that uses your Model to send structured data. Instead of random messages, it sends organized information in a consistent format.

**Why combine Actions with Models?** This creates realistic IoT data that mimics real sensors. Your Action generates sample sensor readings that follow your Model's structure.

**What it does:** Every 5 seconds, it creates sample temperature and humidity data and publishes it using your SensorReading model.

[Create Model Action](command:coreflux.createModelAction)

media.altText: Creating an action that uses a model

steps.title: Hello World with Python
steps.description:
**What is Python integration?** LOT can call Python functions to do complex calculations, data processing, or use Python libraries. This gives you the power of Python with the simplicity of LOT.

**Why use Python with LOT?** Python is great for data analysis, machine learning, and complex logic. LOT handles the IoT communication, while Python handles the heavy computation.

**What you'll create:** A simple Python function that creates personalized greetings, and a LOT Action that calls this function every 5 seconds.

[Create Python Scripts](command:coreflux.createPythonScripts)

media.altText: Creating Python scripts and LOT actions
